title: Quiz 9: Recovery & Development
description: Assess your understanding of the Recovery phase, documentation procedures, and how disasters interact with development.

questions.question: Which of the following is considered 'Short-term Recovery'?

options.text: Restoring interrupted utility services and clearing roads

questions.explanation: Short-term recovery overlaps with response and involves immediate restoration of vital services (utilities, roads).

questions.question: What are the four basic themes regarding the relationship between Disasters and Development? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Rebuilding provides opportunities to initiate development
Development programs can increase susceptibility to disasters
Development programs can decrease susceptibility to disasters
Disasters have no impact on development

questions.explanation: All four A, B, C, and D are the basic themes. Disasters destroy development, offer chances for new development, and development itself can increase or decrease vulnerability.

questions.question: Order the steps of a Recovery Plan logically:
questions.hint: Start with Info, end with Evaluation.

questions.question: Taking pictures of damage is NOT a necessary part of documenting a disaster for outside aid.
questions.explanation: Photographs provide irrefutable evidence and are a crucial part of documentation for assistance.

questions.question: The permanent construction or replacement of severely damaged physical structures and full restoration of services is known as ___BLANK___.
Match the documentation step with its action:

pairs.right: Take pictures of damages and repairs

questions.hint: Match the type of evidence to the action.

questions.question: How can development programs INCREASE vulnerability? (Choose the best example)

options.text: Urban development leading to large-scale settlements on marginal land

questions.explanation: Settlements on marginal land (slums, flood plains) due to urbanization increase vulnerability. The others decrease it.
questions.hint: Which one puts people in danger?

questions.question: Recovery activities continue until:
questions.explanation: Recovery continues until systems are normal or better (build back better).

questions.question: Disasters can serve as a catalyst for political and social change, creating opportunities for development.
questions.explanation: Disasters can improve the atmosphere for change (e.g., land reform, new housing standards).
questions.hint: Can something good come from a disaster?

questions.question: What is the term for the sum total of actions taken by people and institutions in the face of disaster?
questions.explanation: Disaster Response is the sum of actions taken.
questions.hint: It happens when the disaster strikes.
